id: Bears activate Shaheen, place Sims on injured reserve
paragraph: SettingsCancelSetHave an existing account?Already have a subscription?Don't have an account?Get the newsLet friends in your social network know what you are reading aboutChicago Bears activate TE Adam Shaheen from injured reserveA link has been sent to your friend's email address.A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQsCHICAGO (AP) — The Chicago Bears have activated Adam Shaheen from injured reserve and placed fellow tight end Dion Sims on IR.The 6-foot-6 Shaheen has missed the first nine games because of a foot injury.  A second-round draft pick from Division II Ashland in 2017, he caught 12 passes for 127 yards and three touchdowns as a rookie.Sims (concussion) sat out Chicago's win over Detroit last weekend.Chicago announced the moves on Saturday. The NFC North-leading Bears (6-3) host the second-place Minnesota Vikings (5-3-1) on Sunday night.___More AP NFL: https://apnews.com/tag/NFL and https://twitter.com/AP_NFLCopyright 2018 The Associated Press.
